name: Pediatricians
description: Primary care doctors who manage the overall health, growth, and development of children from birth to adolescence.

name: Pediatric Nurse Practitioners (PNPs)
description: Advanced practice nurses who provide primary and specialty care to children, often working in collaboration with pediatricians.

name: Pediatric Dentists
description: Specialists in oral health care for children, including preventive care, diagnosis, and treatment of dental issues.

name: Pediatric Psychiatrists
description: Doctors who specialize in diagnosing and treating mental health disorders in children and adolescents.

name: Child Psychologists
description: Professionals who provide psychological assessments and therapy for children with emotional, behavioral, and developmental issues.

name: Pediatric Occupational Therapists (OTs)
description: Specialists who help children develop or regain skills needed for daily living and school activities.

name: Pediatric Physical Therapists (PTs)
description: Professionals who work with children to improve their physical functioning, mobility, and strength.

name: Speech-Language Pathologists (SLPs)
description: Experts who diagnose and treat speech, language, and communication disorders in children.

name: Family Medicine Physicians
description: Primary care doctors who provide comprehensive health care for individuals of all ages, managing a wide range of medical conditions.

name: Internal Medicine Physicians (Internists)
description: Doctors who specialize in the prevention, diagnosis, and treatment of adult diseases.

name: Geriatricians
description: Specialists in the health care of older adults, focusing on the unique needs and medical issues of the elderly.

name: Psychiatrists
description: Doctors who diagnose and treat mental health disorders in adults, including conditions like depression, anxiety, and bipolar disorder.

name: Cardiologists
description: Specialists in diagnosing and treating heart and cardiovascular system conditions.

name: Endocrinologists
description: Doctors who treat hormonal disorders such as diabetes, thyroid issues, and metabolic disorders.

name: Gastroenterologists
description: Specialists who diagnose and treat disorders of the digestive system, including the stomach, intestines, liver, and pancreas.

name: Orthopedic Surgeons
description: Doctors who specialize in the diagnosis and surgical treatment of musculoskeletal system issues, including bones, joints, ligaments, tendons, and muscles.
